snippet: In the first official gathering of the likely 2013 candidates, Christine C. Quinn declined to vilify Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s diversity record.
abstract: Presumed 2013 candidates for New York City mayor gather at New York University to discuss expanding business opportunities for minority- and women-owned firms; while most candidates criticize Mayor Michael R Bloomberg for a lack of diversity in his administration, City Council Speaker Christine C Quinn steers clear of invective, focusing instead on specific changes she says she would make and trying to accentuate the positive.
lead_paragraph: In the first official gathering of the likely 2013 candidates, Christine C. Quinn declined to vilify Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg’s diversity record.

headline.seo: Thompson, De Blasio, Liu and Stringer Assail Bloomberg
headline.main: Most Would-Be Successors Assail Mayor on Diversity
headline.print_headline: Most Would-Be Successors Assail Mayor on Diversity
